result.execSummary:
The defendant Shay R. Huegli was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shay R. Huegli is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shay R. Huegli was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payment plan granted for ALL monetary obligations: $100/mo. starting on or before 10/01/2022 or one day in jail for every $25.00 then owing, until paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shay R. Huegli

records.addlTxt:
3:33 PM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Shay R. Huegli in court.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Kelz states an agreement has been reached an recites the agreement on record. Contingent upon the defendant's plea to Ct. 2 the State will move to Dismiss Ct. 1. Defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives his right to an Attorney. Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to Ct. 2, therefore Ct. 1 is DISMISSED. Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC. Comments by parties. 

Ct. 1- 
Dismissed

Ct. 2- 
$300 Fine 
$200 DNA + Sample 
$25 Service by DA fees 

Monetary obligations: $100/mo. Starting on or before 10/01/2022 or one day in jail for every $25.00 then owing, until paid in full. 


Appeal Rights Given
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:01 AM DA Calls case and states appearances. Defendant Shay R. Huegli in court.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Kelz states an offer has been conveyed to the defendant by the State and the defendant communicated that he would like time to consider the offer. Court questions the defendant in regards to the agreement. Defendant makes comments and asks questions. Court will set this matter for a plea and sentencing for 09/12/2022 at 3:30pm.
Status hearing on August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Petition for Appointment of Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney- DENIED

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

10:10 AM Defendant Shay R. Huegli appeared in court. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Notice of right to attorney given to DE. DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA
